etymology.description: Pictogram: earliest use denoted the “God of Heaven”; later an imperial title. Shuowen (erroneously) analyzed it as semantic 上 + phonetic 朿.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted a divine or celestial ruler, which is why its earliest sense is the ‘God of Heaven’. Over time it broadened to mean an earthly emperor; the Shuowen’s reading as 上 plus 朿 is a later misinterpretation rather than its true formation.

examples.chinese: 秦始皇称帝(秦始皇稱帝)。
examples.english: Qin Shi Huang proclaimed himself emperor.

examples.chinese: 人们祭祀天帝(人們祭祀天帝)。
罗马帝国的皇帝享有至高权力(羅馬帝國的皇帝享有至高權力)。
examples.pinyin: Luómǎ Dìguó de huángdì xiǎngyǒu zhìgāo quánlì.
examples.english: The emperors of the Roman Empire held supreme power.
